channel.title: C4D - Introduction to Lathe NURBS - Modeling a Wine Glass
channel.description:
I loved doing the chair one, so I thought I'll do another one.
NURBS are important parts of any modeling program. The cut down a lot of work, or do work that would be impossible without them. Amongst the 6 or so NURBS, there is one called the Lathe NURB. Hopefully, by the end of this tutorial, you will understand how they are used and what they do ;)
1. Press F3 and get in to the right view mode. Grab a LINEAR spline and 'draw' something that looks similar to this. Please take note of all the points on the picture: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/7605/81123107ke9.jpg[/img][/URL]
What you see above is what I got after about the 3 attempts. When I finally got something that looks slightly like one side of a 2D glass, I selected certain points the Live Selection tool and manipulated them. Use the black 'toggles' to mess about with the curves from point to point. Keep doing this until you got something that looks like the one above. Remember that I only used one spline and not two. I wanted to give the glass some thickness instead of it being wafer thing.
2. When everything is set select a LatheNURB and make your layer panel look like the second picture down: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/1863/38504093li1.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img115.imageshack.us/img115/3374/95109224cb9.jpg[/img][/URL]
You should now have a model that looks roughly like this: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img115.imageshack.us/img115/6245/36007758fo8.jpg[/img][/URL]
[b]IT IS MEANT TO LOOK BAD AT THIS POINT[/b] If it doesn't look like that, feel free to go back to your spline and mess about with it somemore. As I said, it took my 3 tries to get a semi-decent spline. It looks quite ugly at this point. This is when we bring in a HyperNURB (My favourite :P): [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img53.imageshack.us/img53/8082/65626015ms6.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/5469/71051520yj3.jpg[/img][/URL]
Now we have something that, should, look a lot better: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img53.imageshack.us/img53/2450/91854318iu5.jpg[/img][/URL]
Now, we do the wine inside. Start off by drawling another spline that resembles this: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img53.imageshack.us/img53/6776/91682777ul7.jpg[/img][/URL]
It would be easier to draw this inside the glass so it meets up and [b]ends in the middle of the glass[/b] with the sides and takes up an area like a real liquid would. remember not to make the corners on the wine hard.
Put the spline we just made and put it under a Lathe NURB. It should now take up the whole glass. We should now have something that looks like the following pictures: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/4375/10bk8.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img53.imageshack.us/img53/7023/11av6.jpg[/img][/URL]
Most importantly, we need to make the wine texture. I had to make my own with help from another guide. Here are the material settings you should use: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/15/12ft5.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/4748/13mz9.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/3007/11uc8.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img53.imageshack.us/img53/407/10qh5.jpg[/img][/URL]
In case you don't want to follow that, I have uploaded it for you to use as you will (It's an extremely small file :P) :) http://www.megaupload.com/?d=65H0BQ7B
The glass material can be found in many places. A good place to go would be to go to www.c4dtextures.com and just register, free, there.
After everything is done, you should have something better than this :P Remember, to get best render results, go to Render Settings and change the anti-aliasing to best. This will increase render times by a minute or so, but the difference is worth it. [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/199/wineglasstm5.png[/img][/URL]
;D
